text: Security operations aren't suffering from a 'big data' problem—but rather a 'data analysis' problem. A SIEM can be an incredibly valuable tool for the SOC when implemented correctly. Leverage the Log Lifecycle Poster to add context and enrich data to achieve actionable intelligence—enabling detection techniques that do not exist in your environment today.
Windows Log Channels: Application, Security, System, Powershell, Sysmon, AppLocker, Firewall, Driver frameworks, User mode
Linux/Unix Logs: auth.log, firewall, audit.log, messages.log
Log Collection Types: Agents, Third party, OS Built In, Agentless, Scripting
Log Formats: Unstructured text, CSV, Key Value, JSON, CEF, LEEF
Cloud Logs: Amazon S3, CloudTrail, Microsoft Azure Connect, Event Hub, SaaS API
Network Service Logs - Tools & Options: Logs Created by Applications, Web Servers, DNS, Proxy Logs
Network Extraction Tools: Bro, Suricata, Snort OpenAppID
Log Enrichment Pipeline Stages: Raw Alert, Parse, Geo IP Enrichment, ASN Enrichment, DNS Enrichment, Process Enrichment, File Name Lookup
Geo IP Enrichment adds Country and State information to log events
ASN Enrichment adds ASN Entity information (e.g., Google Inc, Amazon.com, Inc) to log events
DNS Enrichment adds dns_lookup information to correlate IP addresses with domain names
Process Enrichment adds Associated Process information to identify which application generated the network activity
File Name Lookup enrichment adds Associated File information to identify downloaded files
Alert Example 1: ET POLICY PE EXE or DLL Windows file download - After enrichment shows Internet Explorer downloading ChromeSetup.exe from dl.google.com - likely a FALSE POSITIVE

Alert Example 2: ET CURRENT_EVENTS Possible PDF Dictionary Entry with Hex/Ascii replacement - Classification: A Network Trojan was detected - After enrichment shows shipment_notification_555.pdf downloaded from lookalike domain trackmypackage-com.biz using acrod32.exe - HIGHLY SUSPICIOUS
Rule Logic - Search Query: Alert on anything that matches the search query parameters
Rule Logic - Blacklist: Alert any time a field matches on any of the terms on the given list
Rule Logic - Whitelist: Alert any time a field does not match an item on the given list
Rule Logic - First Sighting/New Term: Search back in time X days for all unique entries in a field and alert if any new terms appear
Rule Logic - Spike: Alert when the number of events is higher than a threshold. May be an absolute number of events or percentage larger.
Rule Logic - Flatline: Alert when the number of events is below a threshold for a given time period
Rule Logic - Change: Alert any time the value of the specific field changes
Storage Considerations: Log volume calculation, Data lifecycle and retention, Search speed
Platform Integrations: Security Orchestration, Automation, Response (SOAR), Threat Intelligence Platform, Incident Management System
SIEM Collection Capability - New Deployments - Collection: Collection of logs from critical assets and hosts that access them
SIEM Collection Capability - New Deployments - Context Building & Tool Integration: Building naming standard, basic tagging/categorization
SIEM Collection Capability - New Deployments - Detection and Alerting: High fidelity alert collection, emphasis on rule validation and FP reduction
SIEM Collection Capability - New Deployments - Log Agent Ability: Automatic, installer pushed (SCCM)
SIEM Collection Capability - Established Deployments - Collection: Collection of most at-risk host logs: desktops, servers, and appliances

SIEM Collection Capability - Established Deployments - Context Building & Tool Integration: Consistent naming standard, detailed tagging and categorization, some integration with asset DB/vulnerability management data sources, some automation
SIEM Collection Capability - Established Deployments - Detection and Alerting: High fidelity alert queue, established process for lower fidelity alert storage and periodic review
SIEM Collection Capability - Established Deployments - Log Agent Ability: Fully automated deployment and enforcement on all systems
SIEM Collection Capability - Mature Deployments - Collection: Full tactical log collection on desktops, servers, appliances, mobile devices, and any other relevant assets
SIEM Collection Capability - Mature Deployments - Context Building & Tool Integration: Using all collected info for anomaly detection (enriched with tagging and asset info), SOAR integration

SIEM Collection Capability - Mature Deployments - Detection and Alerting: Upgrading of lower fidelity alerts based on context and automation, applied anomaly detection, data science capabilities for beaconing and DGA detection, UEBA
SIEM Collection Capability - Mature Deployments - Log Agent Ability: Dynamic agent confirmation based on self-assessed services run on host

SANS Training Tier 1: SEC401 Security Essentials - Network, Endpoint, and Cloud (GSEC), ICS410 ICS/SCADA Security Essentials (GICSP), SEC450 Blue Team Fundamentals: Security Operations and Analysis (GSOC)

SANS Training Tier 2: SEC501 Advanced Security Essentials - Enterprise Defender (GCED), SEC555 Detection Engineering and SIEM Analytics (GCDA), SEC511 Cybersecurity Engineering: Advanced Threat Detection and Monitoring (GMON)

SANS Training Tier 3: SEC503 Network Monitoring and Threat Detection In-Depth (GCIA), FOR572 Advanced Network Forensics: Threat Hunting, Analysis, and Incident Response (GCIA), FOR610 Reverse-Engineering Malware: Malware Analysis Tools and Techniques (GREM), ICS515 ICS Visibility, Detection, and Response (GRID), LDR551 Building and Leading Security Operations Centers (GSOM)
